subject: Productivity
title: The Spreadsheet Revolution
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Spreadsheet Revolution.

hook.text: VisiCalc launched in 1979. Businesses bought Apple computers just to run that one program.

buildup.text: Before spreadsheets, recalculating a budget meant redoing every number by hand. It took days.

discovery.text: VisiCalc let users change one cell and watch everything recalculate instantly. Magic in a grid.

twist.text: Spreadsheets eliminated thousands of bookkeeping jobs. They also created millions of analyst roles.

climax.text: Excel, the successor, became the most influential business tool ever made. Entire companies run on it.

punchline.text: A simple grid changed how the world does business.

quiz.question: What made VisiCalc revolutionary?
options: Instant recalculation when one cell changed
It could connect to the internet
